name: NPR
text:
President Trump's campaign announced it has postponed its rally Saturday in Portsmouth, N.H., due to anticipated bad weather. (@nhpr)
https://t.co/st8JlhyXq7

name: NPR
text:
California will release up to 8,000 prisoners this summer in an effort to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. The news comes after more than a third of the inmates and staff at the San Quentin prison tested positive.
https://t.co/7w5XrR4XI4

name: NPR
text:
Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms ordered a return to Phase 1 restrictions amid a record-breaking spike in coronavirus cases. 

But Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp, quickly dismissed the mayor's directive, saying only he has that authority.
https://t.co/WMzSv6tRiv

name: NPR
text:
3 LA police officers face charges of falsifying records and obstruction of justice over allegations that they wrongly identified dozens of people as gang members, the city's district attorney's office says.
https://t.co/l7sPPcyESa

name: NPR
text:
The number of coronavirus cases is soaring in Texas, and the state is rolling back its reopening plans.

"What good is the economy if there's nobody around to spend money?" League City Mayor Pat Hallisey said in support of the safety measures.
https://t.co/Ml4yXGDNtA

name: NPR
text:
Director Gina Prince-Bythewood is the first black woman to direct a big budget superhero movie. 

"I hate the fact that I'm the first ‚Äî in 2020 that we're still having firsts," she says.
https://t.co/XQ9sI24H8t

name: NPR
text:
Researchers took blood plasma from mice that got plenty of exercise and infused it into older, sedentary mice. 

Sure enough, those mice showed improvements in their brains.
https://t.co/tfl1mnN62S

name: NPR
text:
The Netherlands says it will sue Russia for its alleged role in shooting down an airliner over Ukraine 6 years ago that killed all 298 aboard, two-thirds of whom were Dutch. Russia has denied involvement.
https://t.co/bzFMBEX72U

name: NPR
text:
Conspiracy theories need just the right ingredients to take off within a population. 

Here's how one popular COVID-19 conspiracy theory came to be and what made it become so well spread. üëá  https://t.co/bJmEDhpHtG

name: NPR
text:
In 2005, @franklinleonard's anonymous list of the best unmade scripts in Hollywood shook up the movie biz. 

Here's how a math-loving, movie nerd set out to solve the industry's script problem.
https://t.co/qHTzybiG3O

name: NPR
text:
In her new book, "The Alchemy of Us," scientist Ainissa Ramirez unpacks the history of inventions ‚Å†‚Äî and their inventors.

‚ÄúI want the next generation to feel like they, too, can be inventors. It's not the alchemy of a few smart white guys." #NPRShortWave
https://t.co/mHkjSmXKVp

name: NPR
text:
Amid the pandemic, Molly Moon's Homemade Ice Cream has been on the same economic roller coaster ride many small businesses have.

But since opening back up, the shop has been targeted ‚Äî by people on both sides of the debate about policing.
https://t.co/obwYvp1MyY

name: NPR
text: The best new albums out this week include the first posthumous full-length from the late rapper @JuiceWorlddd, singer @MissMargoPrice's best record yet, the return of @RufusWainwright and more. https://t.co/MA0kN1AhSB

name: NPR
text:
Folk singer-songwriter Rufus Wainwright returned to LA, where he made his 1998 debut, to make his new record, ‚ÄúUnfollow the Rules.‚Äù 

He says the title comes from the idea of reexamining the world to make your own decisions. 
https://t.co/aJ9AZdZJ4t

name: NPR
text:
New York says it will begin allowing in-person visits to relatives in nursing homes again, but only for facilities certified as virus-free for at least 28 days ‚Äî and strict rules apply.
https://t.co/CBZTLOL4pO

name: NPR
text:
"The Old Guard" director Gina Prince-Bythewood is the first Black woman to direct a big-budget superhero movie.

"I hate the fact that I'm the first ‚Äî in 2020 that we're still having firsts," she tells NPR.
https://t.co/5HPnWbJ7tC

name: NPR
text: A growing number of Indians are risking their lives to cross the U.S.-Mexico border. U.S. Border Patrol detained 76 Indians in 2007. In 2019, the number exceeded 7,600. https://t.co/1CQI9ArMPz

name: NPR
text:
A recent online poll puts Arizona Gov. Doug Ducey dead last on approval ratings of U.S. governors' COVID-19 response. He's the only governor to earn a lower approval rating than President Trump on the issue. (@kjzzphoenix)
https://t.co/CX7N5yGnj1

name: NPR
text:
Months into the pandemic, it seems like the United States is no better off in dealing with the crisis. There are still so many questions and few definitive answers about how this all ends.

The latest from @NPRItsBeenAMin: https://t.co/Mf8ekwsI80

name: NPR
text:
A Pew survey finds two-thirds of respondents think officers should be held legally accountable for using excessive force ‚Äî but few say they would support cutting police budgets.

The results were skewed by respondents' race and political persuasion.
https://t.co/QxYj2BAzcl

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Mitt Romney called President Trump's commutation of Roger Stone's prison sentence "unprecedented, historic corruption."
https://t.co/xE6n4joSOL

name: NPR
text:
Principal Kimberly Grayson took her high schoolers to the African American history museum in Washington, D.C.

When they came back, they pressed their white teachers to take the same trip.

They went. And a revised history curriculum quickly followed.
https://t.co/jioG89ywpb

name: NPR
text: With big-money corporate backers joining activists to demand change, sports team names like the Washington Redskins are now under review. https://t.co/aA7uVcLcJH

name: NPR
text:
A 30-year stalemate over the name of the Washington Redskins broke when corporate sponsors demanded change, a Native American activist explains. 

Now, several pro sports team names are under review. https://t.co/YKz7uEBo8H

name: NPR
text:
Just like adults, many kids are suffering from confusion and stress right now. Here's how their distress may present itself ‚Äî and how to help them feel better. 
https://t.co/06Un0fA9QV
